Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: We have already launched our new card programme for Russia, and doing our best to give our clients from Europe an opportunity to use plastic and virtual Cryptopay cards as soon as possible. Unfortunately, not everything depends on us, and we have to go through a lot of bureaucracy before we are able to launch our new European card programme. We don‚Äôt want to give any exact timeframes quite yet, but as soon as all the formalities are settled we will be happy to provide you with more details. Please stay tuned for more updates on the matter

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Cryptopay is a UK-based company with some Russian employees as been discussed many times before in this thread.  It‚Äôs not a secret that within the framework of our  Russian card programme our cards are issued by the Russian bank. Please be informed that there is no way to top up the card using cryptocurrencies, but it‚Äôs possible to exchange BTC, LTC, XRP or ETH to RUB or USD at Cryptopay and use these funds to top up the card balance.  The fact that we have a verification procedure doesn‚Äôt in any way imply that we sell documents. We‚Äôre fully compliant with GDPR and prior to that, with Data Protection Act. We take the verification process and storing the documents of our clients very seriously.  Please check your facts before making loud announcements. A bare assertion is not necessarily the naked truth.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: It‚Äôs not a piece of cake to found a company, which will be compliant with the current legislation, in any country, and it‚Äôs definitely not about buying a piece of paper. Cryptopay was founded and has a headquarter in the UK (St. Albans) and 2 additional offices in Portugal and in Russia. Our bank account is in Germany if your concern is that your funds are being traded in Russia. The only thing which applies to Russia is the card issuer for the Russian card programme which is available only for the citizens of Russia. And it doesn‚Äôt affect other products in any way. The reason why our clients choose Cryptopay isn‚Äôt a nationality of our employees, but a reliable and high-quality service, responsive and friendly support team and honest attitude to our customers.

Author: JollyGood
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: You are misleading the very few people that reading this thread and you are doing it deliberately.  To register a company in a country that you are not living in IS a piece of cake.  If I lived in Russia or Canada or India or Philippines or Brazil or anywhere else, I could register a company in UK with minimal effort. I could get a company registered address just as the cryptopay team did at the following address because it is nothing more than a mailing address which can be had for $50 per year: 145/147 Hatfield Road, St. Albans, England, AL1 4JY (All in all the registered "company" fee and "registered address" fee would be around $100. So yes, it IS easy as piece of cake)  Your owners are Russian so stands to reason they would operate from Russian but you give the impression they have multiple offices worldwide and that is nonsense.  As for your headquarters being in UK is a LIE! The address in UK is a mailing address, nothing else. You have no staff in Uk, you have nothing there except a piece of paper to show the "company" (which is a piece of paper) is registered there.  You do not even have a UK bank account. You have offices in Portugal? You have mailing addresses in Portugal. If you have bank account in Germany it would be surprising.  What is the IBAN of the bank account and the name of the account and the address of the account holder and of course what is the name and address of the offices in Portugal and Germany?

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: The company is based in the UK. We have offices in the UK, Russia and Portugal and employees from all over the world. We never claimed everyone working for Cryptopay is born and raised in the UK.   To register a company in a country that you are not living in IS a piece of cake.  Our CEO is indeed Russian but it was never stated that he lives in Russia. Please stop assuming.   As for your headquarters being in UK is a LIE! The address in UK is a mailing address, nothing else. You have no staff in Uk, you have nothing there except a piece of paper to show the "company" (which is a piece of paper) is registered there.  We have staff in the UK. The office is not a mailing address.   If you have bank account in Germany it would be surprising.  Surprise     What is the IBAN of the bank account and the name of the account and the address of the account holder and of course what is the name and address of the offices in Portugal and Germany?   We work with Fidor bank. I will not disclose any information about our founders, our address etc. here. All the information about the company can be found on Companies House website. If you have strong feelings against Russians - we get it, let's leave it at that. There are a lot of people who use our company and love it, it's impossible to be loved by everyone. Have a lovely day.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hey there!  Konstantin, Customer support team-lead is here  I would like to start with an apology.  We indeed have misled you. The office in London is the registered address of the company. That is not a secret and has never been. Unfortunately, our support staff has mixed up this info, bringing the wrong answers to you. But I am here to clear things up.  Small companies use the services of secretaries, corporate assistants and accountants. This is a common practice, as we are sure you know. This role is usually performed by one company, and it always registers its clients at its own address. This way we can receive correspondence from authorities, contractors, etc.  For example, let‚Äôs take a look at the Coinbase registered address. Several thousand companies registered there as well, and that doesn‚Äôt make them a scam company. Here‚Äôs a link: https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/search?q=EC2V+6DN  Once again, I‚Äôm deeply sorry for the misrepresentation.  As for other offices and our employees. We do have two other offices up and running in Lisbon and in Saint-Petersburg. These are fair workplaces for those working there. The management is mainly in Lisbon, while the development team is based primarily in Saint-P. In general, our staff is dispersed between London, Lisbon and Saint-Petersburg, part of our employees works remotely in different places all around the world (from NYC to Thailand).  Having several companies helps us manage the business risks, acquire licenses needed for our business and develop several different products in both regulated and unregulated markets.  Last, but definitely not the least. The product we are offering always is real. We actually had cards available in Europe for a long time with thousands of satisfied, happy customers. And right now we are working to bring everything back on track.  In conclusion, I hope you understand that we never had and never will have any intention to lie. The relationship we have with our customers is built on trust and transparency - this is something that we cherish the most in our business.

Author: JollyGood
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello Konstantin from the Customer Support Team Lead  Thank you for your post, I appreciate it very much and I completely accept your colleague had no intention to lie and that what happened was an oversight, an error. I hope transparency will be key in future.  1) The last I was told, your Cryptopay cards were only in the hands of customers in Russia. Please clarify which EU countries the Cryptopay cards have been delivered to and when shipment started.  2) You mentioned your staff is "dispersed between London, Lisbon and Saint-Petersburg, part of our employees works remotely in different places all around the world (from NYC to Thailand)."  Keeping your remote employees aside and just looking at your offices in London, Lisbon and St.Petersburg I have the following comments to make.  Without doubt there is some physical work space/office where the core of your business takes place is based in Russia. I accept that.  If you have full time employees in a permanent office in Lisbon which focuses on management where employees work on daily basis then please provide the full address.  It seems highly unlikely you have full time employees in a permanent office in London. I believe there is no base in London except a mailing address, please confirm this.  Thank you

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello again!  I‚Äôm up to the moon happy that you‚Äôve accepted our apology! Now let‚Äôs cut to the chase.      1) Here‚Äôs the deal with cards. As far as I understand you don‚Äôt have the whole picture drawn. The Russian card programme is the third card programme we have launched since the company was founded. The first one was launched in 2016 - we started issuing VISA prepaid cards in the partnership with Wavecrest, our main card issuer for this card programme. These cards were available worldwide, not only in Europe, we had clients in Australia, South Africa, South America, New Zealand, Canada and tons of other countries. However, in the end of August 2017, WaveCrest updated their issuing policies in compliance with new VISA rules - from that moment on cards were available only to European residents and residents of countries in the EEA.     We didn‚Äôt want to lose our non-European clients and in September 2017 we started doing business with a new card issuer and developed the second generation of our prepaid cards. Acting as the programme manager, we were registered with the card scheme and certified it under PCI-DSS. The second generation of cards was completely redesigned. Not only did we update the physical design, but we also improved the functionality of the card, and it was backed by a new technology stack.     After a great start and initial roll-out of the new cards to all Cryptopay users in Q4 2017, we were unfortunately forced to shut this programme down due to a disagreement with the BIN provider.     That‚Äôs when we got back to WaveCrest and their prepaid cards. This ¬´first generation¬ª prepaid cards successfully served our users until early January 2018 when lost its Visa license. This canceled cards not only for us, but for almost every other European card provider. And form that day on we were working to bring cards back and continue to do so even now. The Russian card programme was started a month ago and is a first result of what we‚Äôve achieved. We keep negotiating with card issuers and VISA managers to bring cards back to Europe and other territories around the world. Hope this little history throwback will help you understand us better. I‚Äôd also suggest you checking out our ICO landing page https://ico.cryptopay.me/ - you‚Äôll find there the most exhaustive information about us and our products. Also, I‚Äôd suggest you looking through our Telegram chat - people constantly discuss our development there, ask questions and share their feedback: https://t.me/cryptopayico     2) Unfortunately, I won‚Äôt be able to share the direct address with you here. Our offices are not client-oriented and we‚Äôve come to a decision not to post addresses for these offices publicly.     As for London, you‚Äôre not quite right. We do have full-time employees there, of course, due to the nature of several products we are working on currently. Several representatives of our compliance, marketing and B2B relations departments are working there, as well as the director of one of the Group‚Äôs companies Stockflare Securities.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Sorry for the delay! All funds we raised during the ICO are used only for the development and implementation of the products which were chosen as the milestones of our ICO. You can read the detailed information about them in our whitepaper: https://ico.cryptopay.me/ico_cpay_wp.pdf When the ICO was in progress, we were issuing our cards within the framework of WaveCrest card programme. So, the card programme wasn‚Äôt included in the milestones. The closure of the WaveCrest card programme was an unexpected surprise for all of us, and in order to avoid repetition of what happened with our cards, we have decided to take the long, tough road to gain full control over our own programme and become Card Programme Manager. It‚Äôs not an easy way, and we have to go through a lot of bureaucracy before we reach the goal, but despite the obstacles, we move forward. Fortunately, most of the work has already been done. You can read about it in the Card Programme Announcement: https://medium.com/cryptopay/card-programme-announcement-10dc4fd4e7a1  As for Monaco, there are a lot of details which make us different. Cryptopay was founded in 2013, and Monaco only in 2016. The range of the services is also different. For example, at the moment they issue their cards only to Singapore. Europe comes next, followed by the USA. We have launched our Russian card programme and are working on the card programme for EEA countries now. We‚Äôll start working on expanding the list of supported countries shortly after.  The customer support approach we use sets us apart from some of our competitors as well. We communicate like people, not like robots. We don‚Äôt want to provide the typical formalities associated with customer support found in other companies. We take every issue our clients face seriously and work hard to make sure that our clients are satisfied.  We‚Äôve even posted the article about our support team and described our principles and commandments here: https://medium.com/cryptopay/how-to-build-a-financial-service-with-a-human-face-d87dd66cddaf  As for the future of Cryptopay, we will continue to implement new products in accordance with the timeline https://ico.cryptopay.me/ and will do our best to expand the list of supported countries and make our cards available not only for the clients from Russia and EEA countries. Our main goal is to make a contribution to the financial world and make Cryptopay services accessible to everyone in the world. We want our clients to use the whole set of wealth management tools on the go and we are going to make all our services as convenient and understandable as possible. So, it will be a busy year.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes, thank you. Please never ever offer your card products to those who want them anonymously. Anonymity leads to compliance issues. Recent history and experience have shown what these issues do to the card programme. Scammers often use anonymous cards to perpetrate their scams. An example is by using Visa's Personal Payments and MasterCard's Send systems to receive fraudulent payments. Another is by confirming scam accounts with such cards.  A strong and robust card programme is what the community needs. Cards we can confidently use and spend with.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes, this is one of the reasons for our decision not to support anonymous cards on the new card programme. We would like to clarify that we do not in any way assume that if one wants to use the card without verification it makes them a scammer, but as cases mentioned above are quite common it was decided not to issue cards for unverified users. In the context of recent officials' statements and updated regulations we want to be as much compliant as we can, to set a longstanding relationship with the new card issuer.

Author: th00ber
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: This was a month ago. Any news about your planning ?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  Almost all documentary and legal details are finalised, we have passed several tests and checks from our soon-to-be card issuers and now are moving on to the final stage of our negotiations. We have signed a letter of intent and contracts with few card issuers (in order to avoid problems similar to the one we had with WaveCrest) and we are going to have two card issuers in Europe and one in Asia. At the moment along with finishing agreements with them and being approved by VISA. We don't want to give any false promises regarding timeframes, but we can assure you that the wait is almost over. This does takes a substantial amount of time, but, in the context of recent officials' statements and updated regulations we want to be as much compliant as we can, to set a longstanding relationship.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: First of all, thank you for your support! We have already submitted applications for listing to a number of exchanges that we found reliable (Binance, Bittrex, Liqui, Livecoin, CoinExchange, Tidex and a couple more). The first two are overwhelmed with listing requests now and they estimate the time to assess our token and start onboarding to not less than two months. Almost all others have come in touch and we are negotiating listing terms with them - we will keep you informed on the progress as soon as we reach an agreement. You can also join our Telegram channel (https://t.me/cryptopayico) to know all the latest news regarding listing on the exchanges.

Body: Thank you for your kind words, they mean a lot to us! It's our job to make every important aspect of the customer experience better every day

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  In order to ensure the longevity of the project and protect the integrity of the Cryptopay team, their tokens are vested. Vesting ensures the founders‚Äô commitment to building the system in the long-term. Founders and the Cryptopay team will have 2 years vesting with a 6 months cliff. Meaning that Foundation retention and CPAY team tokens are locked in a smart contract, which would release them every 6 months proportionally during a period of two years, starting on the 7th month after the ICO. The information in the whitepaper was written long before we even learnt about the closure of the card program, let along planned the launch of the new one, so the dates being close together are no more than a coincidence. We don't hide the information about the card issuer, but keeping it private for now, because the financial market is a highly competitive area. It is safer to keep it a trade secret for now.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I recommend Mistertango. Been using the card since August last year. No issues whatsoever.  Decent transaction limits. Simple and uncomplicated on-app identity verification system.  You get an IBAN account and a free MasterCard linked to it. The card is the embossed type, accepted globally and has the secure EMV chip embedded on it.  The account can be loaded with bitcoins. That‚Äôs the best part.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Quote from: lx001 on January 08, 2018, 01:06:24 AM   The fee was 0.005 a couple of days ago which is ridiculous, I still have a pending deposit from Hitbtc to EUR account for a couple of days already and there's still nothing. I guess we will have to wait for a new issuer and there is nothing we can do now, it may take months.  Hello,  We calculate the fee based on the average fee of the network. We might set it higher to ensure the funds reach the destination without being stuck unconfirmed for days. I understand it is expensive these days But we can speed up the transactions only by increasing the fee. If you disagree with the fee, it is possible to wait until the network is stable again and the traditional 0.0005 BTC fee is back.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello. Please accept our sincerest apologies for the inconvenience caused. It's our card issuer who has stopped the operation of all cards following the demands of Visa. The good news is that are already working on a new card program, although some preparations and technical changes are required before it can be launched. It's a matter of a few months. If you are happy to wait we will gladly provide the best card then!   Quote from: zazarb on January 08, 2018, 08:40:41 AM I just need withdraw my 20 eur, I missed deadline to spend, or cryptopay has no function to send fiat between user for free like many others  similar service ? Quote from: zazarb on January 08, 2018, 10:53:11 AM In other words 20 eur in cryptopay balance worthless, if I can't withdraw, can't transfer and can't spend? Even if someday fee get back to 0.0005 btc, this does not mean that value at that time will be less. And in general why I should buy again btc, if have purpose to sell (done it, and already  pay fee for exchange and for loading card ) and spend fiat?  No, unfortunately, we don't have such an option to transfer between users' wallets for free. Sorry for the inconvenience The only alternative to withdraw that we can offer is sending 20 EUR to your bank account if you have one in EUR within the SEPA zone. The min withdrawal is 10 EUR so you will be fine. Please note that your account has to be verified.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: This happened to me once, back when I still had the Wave Crest card. It took ages (a month) for the blocked funds to be available for spending again.  There are two options: 1) if the merchant (the online shop) is trustworthy, contact them (the merchant) and ask them to reverse or cancel the second transaction or 2) dispute the transaction by contacting Cryptopay who in turn will contact the card issuer to initiate a charge-back or a dispute of the second payment. The dispute will take time because Visa will give the merchant an opportunity to defend itself from your requested charge back. A lot of time. Weeks (in my case it took a month). I didn't dispute. Wave Crest told me if the merchant doesn't settle the second payment, Visa will automatically credit the funds back to my card. And they did.  If you want the money credited back to your card ASAP, you must proactively work on the matter by contacting the merchant. The merchant should reach out to their bank and have the second payment cancelled and Visa informed of that cancellation.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello!  We really appreciate your dedication and support. Every day we work for users like you to find an alternative card issuer and start issuing our cards to the countries outside the EEA again. We have some progress on the matter. The official announcement will be made once we know all the details. The current cards are not going to work for sure since VISA has updated their terms on 15 October and they are not likely to reverse the old conditions. You can cut the card in half or keep it as it is, it is up to you. We will keep you posted on the progress in getting the new card issuer. Stay with us! Heart, Cryptopay Team

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! We have some good news regarding the new card limits. Our card issuer has agreed to keep the old ones for one more month so more people will get a chance to spend the money from their card's balance if they don't want to get verified and those who intend to raise the limits will have more time to complete their verification. We understand that the verification procedures can be tough and might take a considerable amount of time. We recommend you uploading the verification documents as soon as you can in case there are any issues/additional docs needed. The new card limits will be implemented starting from 17 January. Have a great weekend!  Kind regards, Cryptopay Team

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! Please be informed that your activity score is lower than needed for receiving a promo code. It has to be over 30. We will be happy to give you a promo code once you reach the required score. Cheers!

Author: braveheart
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  It is charged off the card balance. If the card has 0 balance the fee will be charged once the card is loaded again.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  You can load the card off any wallet, if the currency of the wallet is different from the currency of the card, 1% fee is charged. Once you've loaded the card (assuming you have a GBP one), the funds are already stored in GBP and if you pay or withdraw in euros the funds will be converted from GBP to EUR, making it a Foreign Transaction.  Quote  whilst in Spain, in a restaurant a waiter made an error taking payment from a credit card. The payment was cancelled immediately and the new payment made, the initial payment returned. What happens in this case on a prepaid debit card? Can a erroneous payment be refunded immediately or  doe it have to be done another way?  If the transaction is cancelled it will most likely stay pending and will be returned to the account within 14 business days.  Quote from: braveheart on December 18, 2017, 04:44:38 PM I would like to apply for the promo code for GBP card. I would be using the card to pay for goods and services in the UK, online payment and possibly use traveling around Europe.  Could you also clarify on the points in my previous posts?  The code is sent to your private messages    Enjoy using the card!

Author: crisdean
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Dear Cryptopay.me team,  I love your card if I could use it!  Your verification process is slow and is conducted by people who don't really see or check ones documents. I've been rejected a "selfie" because it's not sharp or it's a pdf document, which you offer to upload by the way.  If a photo taken with a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 isn't sharp because it's less than 500kb then please take a decision to change it and hire some dedicated people who do your support.  Your support most likely works from home and checks in occasionally, I'd assume based on the "service" they provide.  Apologies for the rant but your verification is ridiculous. My documents were accepted at a bank and rejected by you. I trust the bank more than I trust you. So please can we get this resolved? I'm short of cancelling my card with you if this idiocy continues.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  Selfie in PDF can't be accepted because selfie needs to be an unedited photo, which is hardly possible to be a PDF file to begin with. Most modern cameras and smartphones, Samsung Galaxy Note 3 included, are capable of making photos bigger than 500kb, if the image is smaller, something must have compressed it (most likely automatically). Feel free to contact us via livechat or email, support@cryptopay.me to solve the issues you're facing. I'm sorry that your experience wasn't positive, but I can assure you that our support team is always happy to assist.

Author: crisdean
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Then why do you offer pdf upload? It doesn't make sense. Anyway I contacted your support. I know you only got a few people who seem to be doing support one day and then chat the other day. Please I really want to use the card. I know have taken a photo with the DSLR and the photo should be fine. /Can someone please confirm?

The fee for using a card in the store that you are talking about (¬£2.85) might have been a foreign transaction fee of 3%. Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  If your address is in the EAA and you don't need to update it, you can use the card without verification as well.  Quote from: kacpersp4 on October 21, 2017, 02:23:12 PM If i already have VCC bought (like year ago) can I still use it without verification?  Quote from: kacpersp4 on October 21, 2017, 02:39:50 PM Quote from: warningsigns on October 21, 2017, 02:31:29 PM Quote from: kacpersp4 on October 21, 2017, 02:23:12 PM If i already have VCC bought (like year ago) can I still use it without verification?  If you do not live in a country allowed by Visa, then your VCC ceased to be valid on 15 October 2017. To reactivate the card, you must submit KYC documents showing and proving that you live in one of those countries in Europe approved for this card.  I have a plastic Visa card from Cryptopay and it is now inactive. I‚Äôm still waiting for an alternative solution.  Could you please tell me what countries are allowed by Visa?  //edit  Nevermind, I already found them.  Quote BTCC has listed the countries unaffected by the change. They are: Andorra, Austria, Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, Belgium, Bulgaria, Canary Islands, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Greece, Greenland, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Isle of Man, Israel, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, and the United Kingdom.  So, if I live in one of these countries, do I have to do ID verification to use card or no?  Hello,  If your billing address is in the EAA your card will still work without verification.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Quote from: servsec on October 28, 2017, 12:15:44 AM  Exactly, I could invest 50.000 usd on this ico but they not prioritize me as client and not resolved the card issue in deadline.  Quote from: btcton on October 28, 2017, 03:37:19 AM  With the ICO craze, *even* if they had solved your issue with your card you honestly would do better not even considering investing in their ICO. They have proven to be not the best of the card providers and besides most ICOs are never worth anywhere near what the total raised funds signify. Furthermore, the real reason more ICOs are even started in the first place is because it is basically free money for the founders who came up with the idea and copied over some random template from some other ICO and changed the color. Just look at how they compare to the others.  In comparison to other ICOs, Cryptopay doesn't have just an idea. It has a working product, a 4-year experience and expertise in both cryptocurrencies and regulated financial system. We are raising funds to make our products better and create new ones (the first milestone already reached!). We don't give any groundless promises and we try to be as transparent as possible. Have you checked our whitepaper? If you wish to compare our ICO with others just have a look at this page https://ico.cryptopay.me/?utm_source=main_page&utm_medium=header_link&utm_campaign=ico_cryptopay#about  Quote from: servsec on October 28, 2017, 07:28:51 AM Yes, agree. Not going to invest as their priority is this ico instead look for a card solution that should come first. In addition they are inconsistent. They delivered a mastercard to me and before it arrives I received an email that the new card will be worthless as well  Guys, we have been trying to fix the card dilemma since the issue occurred but it all happened after our ICO has already started. We couldn't have predicted that the new card program would be shut down. It's not being inconsistent. There are some circumstances that are out of our control, and we have to deal with them. Most bitcoin businesses face the same issues. We can assure you that we have been doing our best looking for an alternative card provider, negotiating, and still are in the process of getting this sorted. We will surely keep our users posted on how it all goes once there are some updates. We believe the success of our ICO and the profit of our token holders won't be affected - we intend to find a solution soon, there is nothing to worry about!

Author: remsonanton
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Got an answer from cryptopay support >  Please be informed that your account contains some information that we would like to verify before unblocking it.  Please kindly send 3 types of documents:  1.) A valid government issued ID - high-quality images of the following documents are acceptable: ‚Ä¢International passport (double page) ‚Ä¢National ID card (both sides) ‚Ä¢Driving license (both sides) Important: To avoid delays when verifying your account, make sure that your submitted documents are: ‚Ä¢Entirely visible (watermarks are permitted); ‚Ä¢Images of high quality (color images, with resolution of 300dpi or higher); ‚Ä¢Valid ID documents with an expiry date (not less than 6 months left) clearly visible.  2.) A proof of residency - a high quality scanned images or a direct online extract of the following documents: Bank statement of your current account, Utility bill, Credit card statement, Loan-related statements, Tax return, Council tax bill, Certificate of residency issued by a government, within the last 3 months and addressed to your name and home address. We cannot accept mobile phone bill, insurance documents or advertising letters as a proof of residence.  3.) A selfie with your ID document in your hands.    P.S. What about anonymous? I deposited a few $ on my acc and got blocked? My friends had money on accounts - the same problem.  Anyone here? Anyone, did you have the same problem with cryptopay? Why did they ban accs?

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World

Author: ice18
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Can I have some promo codes OP? I want to try using cryptopay on my online payment transactions by using virtual debit card Im also planning to order the physical card for exchanging my bitcoin into fiat via atm.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  We have contacted you via email. The funds were refunded to your account. We do not keep your money, the thing is that the amount you are trying to withdraw is less than a minimum withdrawal limit. We are sorry that at the moment the cards are not available, and we'll do our best to find a way out and extend the list of the supported countries, but so far you may feel free to use our service as a wallet, there is no restriction for that.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  We were taking a while to reply recently, but I can assure you we answer to all requests we get, sorry for the delay. If for some reason you haven't received feedback yet, please contact us again.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: VISA cards still work for EU residents, both verified and unverified.  Quote from: poordeveloper on October 13, 2017, 03:53:28 PM Do you mean they disabled your country and kept the money?  The cards with billing addresses outside the EEA have been suspended and the balance has been transferred to the user's wallet. Wallets are still available for everyone.  Quote from: aigeezer on October 13, 2017, 11:39:16 AM I used the MC yesterday with no issues, fwiw. I unloaded the Visa card recently and restored to BTC before this latest BTC moon-shot - pure luck. I'm leaving the MC loaded for now. Gulp.  The company has treated me well so far, but they are in a difficult situation so almost anything could happen next. Don't ever risk what you can't afford to lose.    Thank you for your trust. You can still unload your card and use it for purchases until 5th of December. We will return the cost of the card to your Cryptopay account till October 25th. If you still have funds left on your card after 60 days, don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôll also return them to your account. If your billing address is in the EU we'll gladly issue a VISA card as a replacement.  Quote from: futurebitcoins on October 16, 2017, 06:33:46 AM Quote from: hiddensphinx on October 15, 2017, 01:01:37 PM MasterCard Removes Cryptocurrency Debit Card Availability Outside EEA  https://themerkle.com/mastercard-joins-visa-in-removing-cryptocurrency-debit-card-availability-outside-of-the-eea/  So no more Cryptopay debit card for customers outside of Europe!  No point in investing in their ICO now        That means currently no cards will work outside EEA right? OR do we have an option to use these cards in Asia? Quote from: Danslip on October 16, 2017, 11:34:24 AM Quote from: hiddensphinx on October 15, 2017, 01:01:37 PM MasterCard Removes Cryptocurrency Debit Card Availability Outside EEA  https://themerkle.com/mastercard-joins-visa-in-removing-cryptocurrency-debit-card-availability-outside-of-the-eea/  So no more Cryptopay debit card for customers outside of Europe!  No point in investing in their ICO now        Good point... Mentioned news will make things tough for bitcoin debit card industry.Better to look for other options like making agreement with Visa or other payment providers. Developers should give us info immediately after this news.  The current list of countries our card issuer works with can be found here https://mychoicecorporate.com/visa-card-issuance-list/  At the moment we are doing our best to find a way to issue and deliver Cryptopay cards worldwide again.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: There is something in what you are saying, guys. The regulations for bitcoin businesses are getting stricter and stricter but we don't give up. At the moment we are doing our best to find a way to issue and deliver Cryptopay cards worldwide again. We are negotiating with several card providers and hopefully we'll sort it out soon! Cross your fingers!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! As far as I remember from our conversation in the live chat, in the end you've been able to view your USD account history in the app. Our tech team has been investigating your case but they need at least a bitcoin address where you sent funds to and the Tx of that transaction. They will be happy to credit bitcoins if everything is OK with the transfer.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes they have virtual cards but to get one you must be verified and you must also pass their partner bank's KYC requirements. One of those requirements is to have a utility bills or verifiable evidence of residence in the European Union or in those countries the cards are restricted to.  If you don't live in Europe, you can't get any of the current cards offered by Cryptopay. The card is issued by Wave Crest.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: If you do not live in a country allowed by Visa, then your VCC ceased to be valid on 15 October 2017. To reactivate the card, you must submit KYC documents showing and proving that you live in one of those countries in Europe approved for this card.  I have a plastic Visa card from Cryptopay and it is now inactive. I‚Äôm still waiting for an alternative solution.

Author: btcton
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Or any other ICO, for that matter. A lot of the companies that were running ICOs for services related to Bitcoin debit cards or such with access to USD funds and the Visa and Mastercard networks will now be losing most of their funding options. Many ICOs already fail while having global contributions. Limiting the contributions to the European geographical area is just going to make it harder for them, Cryptopay included. Truth is though, this is getting significantly saturated with many companies doing the same thing for the same locale.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: It looks like this card will not work in few countries because I got this message from them after I requested a card.  We‚Äôre very sorry to inform you that due to reasons beyond our control, we‚Äôve been forced to stop issuing and maintaining cards on the new card program. We understand this sounds bad. However, the most important thing for us is the security of our customers, so we‚Äôve decided to turn off the current program. At the moment we are doing our best to find a way to issue and deliver Cryptopay cards to xxxxxxx. When they are available for the residents of your country, we will definitely let you know.  But I didn't understand one thing that when I key in my country they should have stopped me at that point instead they waited until I submit my card request to send this email.  If your investing in their ICO project by thinking that this card works world wire and demand will be more then you better think and invest.

Author: usukan
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: just beware  The rules have all just changed  While Cryptopay cards are accepted all over the world, the number of countries where we can issue and deliver them to is limited. Check the following list before ordering the card and make sure your country is presented here:  Andorra Austria Bailiwick of Guernsey Bailiwick of Jersey Belgium Bulgaria** Canary Islands Croatia** Cyprus Czech Republic Denmark Estonia Finland France** Germany Gibraltar Greece** Greenland Hungary Iceland Ireland Isle of Man Israel Italy Latvia Liechtenstein Lithuania Luxembourg Madeira Malta Monaco Netherlands Norway Poland Portugal Romania** San Marino Slovakia Slovenia Spain Sweden Switzerland Turkey United Kingdom Vatican City    I have ordered a card which is now USELESS  If you are not on this list forget this Debit Card  When I ordered - it was valid - now its not.  In the middle of an ICO this is totally unacceptable.  Beyond their control they say:  Quote https://help.cryptopay.me/cryptopay-bitcoin-debit-card/general/changes-regarding-our-card-program  Changes regarding our card program   Written by Cryptopay Team Updated this week Due to reasons beyond our control we‚Äôve been forced to stop issuing and maintaining contactless cards on the new card program.  We understand this sounds really bad, but unfortunately we will not be able to provide card service to our customers outside the European territory.  All expenses such as card orders and delivery payments will be refunded till October, 25th.  The good news for our European users is that they can switch back to their old Cryptopay card and continue using it. Both loads and unloads are available now! For those who don‚Äôt have our old card we will reissue it free of charge.  We are looking for a solution for our non-europeans customers and will notify you about it as soon as we resolve this issue.  Thank you very much for understanding.    So just beware before ordering this card - at least wait if you are outside the EU until and IF INDEED they can sort out these problems.   I have withdrawn all funds from Cryptopay until they come up with solutions - "support" does not seem to answer questions.   Cheers - usukan

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  Please contact us via email support@cryptopay.me. You can put your forum nickname in the title of the email so we can find your email easily. Thank you.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! The card loads have been turned off because we were forced to stop maintaining our contactless MasterCard cards on the new card program due to the reasons out of our control. The cost of the card and the express shipping (for users who qualify) will be refunded till 25 October. At the moment we are doing our best to find a way to issue and deliver Cryptopay cards to the countries outside the EU. Please accept our apologies for the inconvenience this has caused you

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Good day! Please find the promo code for a free virtual card in your direct messages. First, check if your billing country is listed among the supported countries https://help.cryptopay.me/cryptopay-bitcoin-debit-card/general/what-countries-does-cryptopay-issue-cards-to

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  Unfortunately, we don't issue cards to Iran. We're sorry about it and we're currently working on expanding the list of countries we work with. Stay tuned!  Quote from: thedarksun on October 08, 2017, 11:59:45 PM Hello,  I would like to buy one your card for my cousin that is 17 year old. Do anyone under 18 can use your card in legal way?   Hi!  To be eligible to use Cryptopay, one must be at least 18 years old (or the applicable age of majority and contractual capacity if you reside in a jurisdiction where the age of majority or contractual capacity is above 18 years of age).

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: You can write us at support@cryptopay.me or in the live chat on the website, and our support agents will help you with the refund!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! Unfortunately, there was no way for us to fix that issue. We regret to inform you that we were forced to stop issuing and maintaining our contactless MasterCard cards on the new card program due to the reasons out of our control.  We understand this sounds bad but the good news is with the billing address in any of the supported countries users are eligible to order a VISA card for free. Please accept our apologies for the inconvenience this has caused you

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  It was not our decision to stop issuing the cards outside the EU. Believe me, we were as stricken by it as you probably are now. We did everything in our power to find the solution. However, the decision was made by the global general purpose cards provider without prior notice. We are not allowed to disclose the brand or the grounds for this. The finance world is tough enough, not to mention the cryptocurrency business.  We are still discussing the chances of restoring the program, but such negotiations can take months and even years. We believe it would be dishonest to promise anything to our users now, hence the program was suspended and the payments refunded.  You were able to see your country on the list because the change happened without the prior notice, so we had to change everything really quickly. I'm very sorry for the inconvenience caused.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Good day!  We are sorry that you have encountered such an issue with your Cryptopay card order but please don't worry. If you won't be able to get verified the cost of the card will be refunded. In fact, background checks are quite common with the credit/debit card providers. Unfortunately, there is noting we can do to avoid them. Try sending the verification documents and we'll go from there.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes, we are not licensed to offer services in the US. So the card can't be issued with the US billing address. One user can only have 1 virtual and 1 plastic card per each currency.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I have both the new USD and EUR contactless cards. They work perfectly. Accepted at merchants and ATMs here in Asia.  I still have my MyChoice card. It is still valid unti 15 October this year. The advantage is the new card's USD 5k withdrawal limit plus the MyChoice card's USD 2k limit. This bridging time makes it easy to convert most of my cold storage coins into fiat.  For the new cards, I think they only support verified accounts. I don't see any limit option for non-verified accounts. They might support lower limit cards for those who don't want to go through the verification process but for now I think they only offer the new cards if you can successfully complete the verification requirements. I wasn't required to submit new documents.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I'm also happy with developments so far. I have my new USD and EUR plastic cards, activated them and used both at ATMs already. I also have the virtual card, active and with generous limits.  I recommend Cryptopay's cards. The Wave Crest card, which I enjoyed for over a year, is coming to an end on 15th Oct but it's good to see a new card provider with far better card features. Contactless payments, USD 5k per day/event limit, separate and independent limits for each card. I hope Cryptopay's relationship with this new card provider will be one that will outlast the short partnership they had with Wave Crest.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: The debit cards are activated within the Cryptopay account (or their app). It's easy and fast. Simply input the last four numbers of the card and activation is complete. Simple and quick.  I received my new Cryptopay card and activated it. It's a black EMV-chipped and contactless (MasterCard PayWave) type of prepaid card. Looks really nice. It has the currency (USD) embossed directly below my name. The even nicer part is having this card with a withdrawal limit of  USD 2k per day coupled with the MyChoice visa card which is still valid until 15 October 2017. The visa card has a separate USD 2k limit. So I could actually withdraw up to USD 4k between now and October 15th. The limits are separate and not shared.  I ordered a virtual card and it is has been pending for quite some time now. Will wait but in the meantime I'm happy with this new plastic card.

Body: Quote from: Elpeor00 on September 07, 2017, 06:14:04 PM If Cryptopay can't issue new cards rigth now they should at least give advise before take your order, we are wasting our time asking for a card and we are not sure if the current terms (as the website lists it) will aply with their future card programs, taking our orders (and money) before set up a working program is unprofessional at best and borderline scam at worst. Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Quote from: Samarkand on September 09, 2017, 05:12:55 PM I don¬¥t work for Cryptopay, but I can provide you with a source that confirms your suspicion: https://news.bitcoin.com/bitcoin-debit-cards-non-european-residents-visas-new-rules/  If you reside in Europe, you will still be able to continue using Bitcoin debit cards provided by a debit card provider that issues their cards using Wavecrest (https://www.wavecrest.gi/).    You are both right, guys. The new cards will be available for the users outside the EU. The EU users are welcome to either use the existing VISA cards or replace them with MasterCard for free (if verified). Please note that Cryptopay will stop supporting the MyChoice cards (card loads and unloads) at some point in the future. It is a matter of several months but we will definitely keep our users informed of the exact deadlines.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! The new card issuer is PSI Pay Ltd., UK. As for the verification requirements, we have to collect this very amount of info from you in order to comply with the KYC regulations and anti-money laundering laws of the UK. Currently, many financial services require a selfie ID to get their customers verified, it is a common practice. Just make sure you follow the instructions given and the verification process won't be as tough as it seems

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! You will receive a new MasterCard if you apply now. The promo code is still valid. Would you like to get one?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! The situation you are describing could have never happened if you checked out the User Agreement before putting a tick in the checkbox in the card order form. It is there for a reason. The paragraph where we state that our services aren't available for the USA due to the financial regulation and digital currencies policy is marked in red as IMPORTANT https://cryptopay.me/legal and is hard to miss. Moreover, it is impossible to select the US as a billing country in the card order form. So, you must have ordered the card to an invalid or fake billing address in one of the supported countries and the card order has been processed. This is the only case I can think of when you could have been refused a refund. Otherwise, if the order was still being processed, our support agents could have canceled it and made a full payment refund to your Cryptopay wallet upon your request. Please contact us via the live chat or email (support@cryptopay.me) should you need any further clarifications. Thanks.

Author: Prothius187
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: hahaha, you're a good shill for them.  They are crooks.   There are still laws about how payments can be accepted by credit issuing organizations, and one fact is that if they accept payment for a good or service, and they can't provide it, then they must refund the money.  No matter how you justify what they're doing by saying that American's are just screwed by our own government, the reality is that this organization is just fine in allowing a person to register and try to verify, where I also identify myself as an American, and then accept money from us and then, immediately, tell me I don't qualify and they're not returning my money.  This is completely crooked.  You can't justify it, and if you try, then you obviously have an incentive to protect said behavior.  I recommend all Americans citizens avoid this company like the plague unless you just want to be taken by them.  The good news is I also filled out an application with Wagecan, and I have already received approval and my card is on the way.  The immoral behavior from this company will also tell you what will happen to you in the future.  One of the tests I use to determine who to do business with is how they act during times like this and the types of policies they enforce.  It's obvious this company doesn't care about the customers, and if given 'any' opportunity, they will screw them.  Buyer be warned.

Author: Prothius187
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: And why isn't this on that registration page overtly?  Because you hope that some people will register and then pay you, and you can keep the funds.  Which is exactly what you did.  If you cannot provide cards to Americans, then you should tell us on the registration page.  Where have you declared this?  No where except if someone clicks into the terms of service and reads the entire thing to find where you've hidden it.  No matter how you justify this behavior, you could easily have your website 'identify' customers from the US and simply turn them away.  Instead, you've chosen a crooked way to do business.   Here's a suggestion, which only takes a couple minutes of your time.  Go to your website and add a line on the first page of the registration, "Sorry, we don't accept any US citizens, as our card issuer isn't allowed to issue to you".  Very easy, takes very little time, but instead you're accepting money and screwing as many Americans as you can sucker while we very quickly try to solve a problem for ourselves.  You are preying on people.  You can't justify what you're doing, because it is easily fixed by adding a couple lines of text on your website.  Or you could add a box that says "I'm not an American" to allow registration, but instead you're relying on the old bait 'n switch tactics used by crooked organizations.  You didn't identify the issue, and you blame the customer for not reading terms of service about whether you accept American customers.  Again, the ONLY response from you is that you have it in your 'terms of service'.  What a feeble excuse.  Announce your real intentions on your main webpage, so everyone can understand you provide no service to Americans, and stop taking money from people that you can't serve.  This is no different than me setting up a webpage to provide a certain good, and then when you buy it from me, I claim that "in my terms of service, I said that I cannot serve people from XXX country", sorry so now I'll keep your money because you didn't read it.   That is a completely unethical way of going about your business.  You obviously prefer this business model, as the VERY FIRST email I received from you, was that statement.  So funny, how quickly you sent that to me, so you could keep the money.  As I said, I'll accept the loss of $70 as my lesson that your company is completely unethical business-wise.   Again, for all people who are thinking about this company....Buyers beware.  If they change their terms of service, then you're next and without disclosing anything to you, because....of course....you're at fault for not noticing and sending them money.

Author: Prothius187
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: In response to what you said here:  Moreover, it is impossible to select the US as a billing country in the card order form. So, you must have ordered the card to an invalid or fake billing address in one of the supported countries and the card order has been processed. This is the only case I can think of when you could have been refused a refund. Otherwise, if the order was still being processed, our support agents could have canceled it and made a full payment refund to your Cryptopay wallet upon your request.  Your agents didn't offer a refund, and I asked her for one.  I'm an American living abroad in China.  Did you not think of this?  There are many Americans living in other countries.  So in reality, what you're admitting to is a lie.  When your agent realized that I was living in China, and in fact I wrote an email to her stating why did they deny me, because I'm living in China, she gave me that unethical response from you.  I wrote an email last week stating:  Also, you do realize that I don't live in the US?  I live in China...  And another email I sent:   Otherwise, you need to refund me for my plastic card, and expedited delivery and for my virtual card. I paid both of these using bitcoin. You will need to refund my bitcoin, so that I can draw this money out.  The response was:  I regret to inform you that we are not licenced to offer services to the US residents or citizens, which is stated in our terms and conditions. That is the reason why we were forced to deny your verification, as well as to suspend your plastic card and cancel a virtual card order. Sorry for the inconvenience caused!  Again, you did NOT refund me after the request.  In fact, you merely stated, again, that you were keeping the money because I didn't find in the terms of service where it stated this.  You trying to convince people that you're not scamming them isn't true.  All of my verification paperwork I sent to you showed and proved I lived in China, and yet you still just used the same excuse.  The reasoning is so you can keep the money.   If you weren't trying to be dishonest, then do a refund to my account and I will confirm it here.  Your admission above that your agents would have 'refunded me' and you trying to say I scammed you with incorrect information is fraudulent.  I can prove what I sent to you is accurate data, and I can prove you haven't refunded me.  The facts presented from you already are:  1.  You don't accept Americans 2.  If the application was accurate, your agents would have noticed and refunded the money  You did none of the above.  You didn't identify immediately that you don't accept Americans, even those living abroad who are NOT in America.  I know the limitation for this, but many of us are living/working abroad and haven't had issues with this in the past.  I know America limits deliveries of these debit cards there, as I was a customer of Wirex for years and they sent my cards to China.  Secondly, my application was accurate, and yet you lied that your agents would have refunded me.  They never did.  I identified to them that I live in China and what was the problem.  When they told me, I asked for a refund clearly, and instead of refunding, you scammed me and kept the money.  That is the truth, there is no exaggeration my part.  I paid you in good faith, I sent you accurate information about me, and you've chosen to simply keep the money.  If you're not a scam, then arrange to have my bitcoin returned to me through your agents.  I will update my posts here if you do it.  If you don't....then everything is exactly as I have stated about you.

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Their MyChoice visa cards are issued by Wave Crest which has since been acquired by and merged to Visa International. The cards are valid until 15th October 2017. On that day, all MyChoice visa cards issued to non-EU residents will cease to be valid. Visa intends to restrict MyChoice usage to those who live within the EU only (plus Israel and Turkey).  Cryptopay is transitioning to a MasterCard system. The transition is an immediate one so you can apply for this card now. When fully verified, you can purchase their card. As for non-verified accounts, I am not aware of their limits or if they even allow it for the new card. Check with their staff. They can give you a more authoritative answer about this.  I have been using Cryptopay's Wave Crest visa card since mid-2016 and have only good things to say about it.

Author: Prothius187
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Don't trust them.  They're a scam.  I filled out the documents for their card, and then sent bitcoin.  Their response was that I was a US citizen and that it was in their terms that they can't serve Americans, so they are keeping the $70 expedite plastic card + expedite fee I sent them.  I wrote them back and their response was again the same.  Filled out the form, but you're supposed to know that they can't serve US citizens and they will keep any money you send to them.  They refused the refund.  Here was their only response:  We can only offer a promo code for a free card (not express delivery). I am sorry that you've encountered this situation, but it is stated in our terms that we are unable to provide services to the US residents/citizens. Best regards, Olga Savelyeva  This was the second time they said it in email.  The first time they immediately used that "it is stated in our terms that we are unable to provide services to the US residents/citizens.", so they're using this canned phrase to burn all the US citizens who send them bitcoin.   Stay away from them.  They're dishonest and crooked.  Lost $70.  I accept it as the price for learning about a scam.  Prothius

Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: They are not crooks. They correctly and appropriately responded to an American who was too idiotic and illiterate to understand the simple phrase "Americans are not welcome".  Americans are not being burned by Cryptopay. Ask your own government about their over-pregnant policies about meddling in the financial affairs of Americans which is why most financial institutions beyond the borders of the United States would rather not deal with such cumbersome bureaucracy.  You're just feeling so hurt and mentally traumatized by the fact that cards issued outside the U.S. are off limits to American citizens. Get over it. The rest of the world are equally ineligible to open accounts in the U.S. without a valid SSN or TIN. An eye for an eye.

We still do not require verification for ordering virtual cards if your billing country is included in the list https://help.cryptopay.me/cryptopay-bitcoin-debit-card/general/what-countries-does-cryptopay-issue-cards-to (except for the countries marked with **). Author: warningsigns
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi.. I have a fully verified Cryptopay account and the MyChoice visa card. I was invited to upgrade to your new contactless card. After completing the order procedure, I was prompted to pay and the promo code (plastic reissue) was applied to the price. However there was an error during the payment. The order didn't go through (but I sent the bitcoins) and it cancelled so I had to do it again. Ana (your staff) returned the bitcoins to me.  I ordered again and this time it went through smoothly. It is now showing as pending and being processed. I just wanted to ask why the promo code was refused for the second order. I was getting the error "promo code invalid" probably because it was applied to the first order which was cancelled.  I ended up upgrading and paying for the card which was supposed to be free for existing verified card holders which was what your co-founder's George's emailed invitation was all about. $15 isn't much and I paid it but I was hoping loyal long-term Cryptopay customers like me would have enjoyed the fee waiver.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Quote from: Raggsock on July 04, 2017, 03:18:40 PM Hi, I would like a promo code. Plan to use the card for mostly online payments but also ATMs and in stores if it works well.  Quote from: Rux on July 04, 2017, 11:08:26 PM Can i get a promo code?  im gonna use it to make review for my forum members... they cant wait for me to test it for them  and also gonna use it for some POS/ATM stuff to brag to people i know ...  The promo codes have been sent to your personal messages guys! We hope you will enjoy using our card and will recommend it to your friends    Quote from: BitMaxz on July 04, 2017, 11:42:57 PM Hi are you still giving promo code i would like to get one debit card and use it for verifying my paypal account and using it to buy services online.. And hoping that this will work to buy services online in majestic or in seoclerk. Many thing that i want to do with the debit card..  Yes, you will be able to use the card to verify your PayPal account but the card has to be fully verified. In order to verify your account, you will need to submit 2 types of documents:  1.) A valid government issued ID - high-quality images of the following documents are acceptable: ‚Ä¢ International passport (double page) ‚Ä¢ National ID card (both sides) ‚Ä¢ Driving license (both sides) Important: To avoid delays when verifying your account, make sure that your submitted documents are: ‚Ä¢ Entirely visible (watermarks are permitted); ‚Ä¢ Images of high quality (color images, with resolution of 300dpi or higher); ‚Ä¢ Valid ID documents with expiry date (not less than 6 months left) clearly visible.  2.) A proof of residency - a high quality scanned images or a direct online extract of the following documents: Bank statement, Utility bill, Tax return, council tax bill, Certificate of residency issued by a government, within the last 3 months and addressed to your name and home address. We cannot accept mobile phone bill or a credit card statement as proof of residence.  Note: For languages such as that use non-Latin characters, a certified translation of your proof of residence document is needed.  As for buying services online in majestic or in seoclerk, the card will work if they accept prepaid debit cards without 3D secure.  Please, kindly find the promo code for a free card in your personal messages!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  As far as we know, 4AMLD is a directive, not a law. It is there to ensure countries implement the stricter regulation on prepaid cards. At the moment, if a country chooses to relax CDD requirements for e-money, it must still ensure that issuers carry out sufficient transaction monitoring and issuers must demonstrate that the risks associated with e-money are low. This is a way we can still keep higher limits for now. Nevertheless, we strongly advise you to verify your account, because government regulators become more and more demanding to financial services these days.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! Such situations happen when our card issuer rejects one of your verification documents. They have very strict requirements regarding the size, the quality, the date of issue, the type of the documents in order to upgrade the clients' KYC limits. Please ask your friend to contact our support directly via live chat or email and we will investigate the case. Thank you!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello! The issue might be with the personal info you enter. Please, note that we only provide the service in the following countries https://help.cryptopay.me/cryptopay-bitcoin-debit-card/general/what-countries-does-cryptopay-issue-cards-to. If your country is included, make sure that you have put the tick in the checkbox to accept the terms and conditions. Contact the support team directly if the issue persists. Good luck with the card order!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: We have good news for the old and new users with the unverified accounts! Of course, we do realize that the new limits are quite frustrating, that's why we have been doing our best negotiating with our card issuer and finally convinced them to revert the limits. We are happy to inform you that the old limits have been activated again today!  Quote from: Bitflaire on June 28, 2017, 02:22:53 PM Is Visa supposed to inform the "tax administration"?  VISA will disclose the info on your spending and transactions only upon a law enforcement request.  Quote from: tiggytomb on June 28, 2017, 02:31:28 PM ...what cards are you bringing out Cryptopay?  if they are prepaid cards they will fall within the same regulation.  The new card will be a contactless MasterCard. More details are following soon!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Quote from: Bitflaire on June 28, 2017, 02:22:53 PM Will there be different limits or always 100‚Ç¨ for unverified accounts? If the limits will be the same I don't get the good news  Quote from: tiggytomb on June 28, 2017, 02:31:28 PM This is the case with all the prepaid cards now, although the ¬£100 is smaller than others I have seen, others have a max of ¬£250 for unverified.  Either way it is the end of the prepaid cards unless you verify, what cards are you bringing out Cryptopay?  if they are prepaid cards they will fall within the same regulation.  ATTENTION! We have good news for the old and new users with the unverified accounts! Of course, we do realize that the new limits are quite frustrating, that's why we have been doing our best negotiating with our card issuer over the last couple of days and finally convinced them to revert the limits. We are happy to inform you that the old limits have been activated again today! Check them out on the following page https://cryptopay.me/bitcoin-debit-card Cryptopay ‚ù§Ô∏è you!!!  Quote from: RavenVox on June 29, 2017, 02:28:29 PM Hello, well I have an Update, I received from you the Visa card today via DHL here in Brazil, and it's the same than the one received from competitors (provided by My choice too) and that's working fine for me. Thing is you rejected my application for this card as I'm originally from Morocco, and then you sent it to me...I wonder what for? Could you please send me via PM a phone number to call? No one is answering me on the Chat support...I want either lifting the 100usd limit or get a refund please. I would appreciate your help.  Unfortunately, we do not have a phone support but you can always contact our friendly customer success team via live chat or email and they will be glad to assist you. Hopefully, the news about the come back of the old limits will make you feel better! Now you will be able to load and spend up to 1000 USD/GBP/EUR from your card. Should you wish to raise these limits, submit the documents for verification and our compliance officers will review them within 1 business day. Cheers!

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Have you read the update about the limits? We have reverted the old ones! Check them out here https://cryptopay.me/bitcoin-debit-card You do not need to get verified to spend up to 1000 USD/EUR/GBP from your cards. If you still would like to get your money back, there is an account closure procedure. Please contact our support team via the live chat or email and they will be happy to assist you.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: That's correct, good memory! Previously it was possible to load up to $2500 to an unverified card but only $1000 to withdraw from it which, in our opinion, didn't make much sense, hence why we have convinced our card issuer to review these limits. Now the loading and unloading limits are even.

Author: spatifilium
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I received a mail from cryptopay: You know, there are some things in life that are totally out of our control. Long lines, rain on a weekend when you planned to have a picnic with friends, speed limits on a highway‚Ä¶ This letter is to let you know about one more thing like this.  The 4th EU Money Laundering Directive (4MLD) that will take action on 26 June, 2017. In line with this document, starting from 26th of June, all limits for unverified clients will change in accordance with the government regulators‚Äô guidelines:      The maximum load for an unverified cardholder across all cards will be reduced from ‚Ç¨ 2,500 to ‚Ç¨250.      The maximum unload through point of sale transaction and ATM withdrawal for an unverified cardholder across all cards will be restricted to ‚Ç¨100.  To summarize, to be able to load more than ‚Ç¨250 or to exceed the spending limit of ‚Ç¨100, the cardholder has to be verified.  We hate to break the news this way and, at the same time, understand that verification procedure is really tough. That‚Äôs why we offer a full-scale support on each stage of the process.  It explains everything, why I can not transfer BTC to my debt card

Author: spatifilium
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: They will not share any information but Visa will(When you load your debit card), if such  law is at your country that all transactions must be notified to the tax administration and then they, if you make a bigger transaction or you spend a lot of money, you are obliged to pay tax to your state, but there are a lot of factors such as how much is your income, which tax group you belong to, it is difficult to say when it is different in each country. example for my country is that all over 250 $ per month what I earn over the internet (thats my other income) I am obliged to pay a sum of 30% to my country because it is not income from my salary but an additional income, that's why I'm not a big fan of verification  I am a citizen of EU and this is not a lot of money which is tax free

Author: Bitflaire
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Cryptopay has updated the card limits according to the 4MLD. In case of exceeding founds (because of the old limits), other card reseller like Uquid or Advcash simply move the money to the BTC wallet to allow a Withdrawal if an user doesn't like to get verified while Cryptopay "locks" the card founds with the impossibility of do anything if not verified (this is stealing money). Moreover they didn't show any warning in the user account's page of this circumstance in advance.  Cryptopay gives our money back and let us convert the exceeding founds back to the BTC wallet .

Author: FlamebergUA
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Just an update I had to learn the hard way: as of now, cryptopay doesn't allow you to use unverified cards at PayPal at all. At least that's what happens if you're a new user: PayPal will not be able to process the addition of your card and CryptoPay staff said in web-chat that it's a new 'bank policy'.  So, basically, to use it with PayPal in any way you need to verify your card - share your ID with CryptoPay.

Author: aigeezer
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: You posted something similar on the Wirex thread. Did you really order two different debit cards with express shipping at about the same time?  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1392468.msg19301650#msg19301650  No problem if that's the case - just wondering if you were having issues with one provider or two.  They both use the same bank, so that's one likely bottleneck. Also, fwiw, I've found DHL to be very unhelpful when it comes to tracking and actual delivery - they seem to excel at the long distance part of their business but drop the ball on "last mile" deliveries. There was a thread about DHL a while back.  I got a Cryptopay plastic card by regular delivery about two weeks after ordering it. Postal service only, from a different continent. I had expected to have to wait up to an extra month.  Murky stuff. I hope you get your card(s) soon in any case.
