Author: aigeezer
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Thanks, got it this time.  I found it easy to sign up to the site. I noticed a couple of little quirks, no big deal. For example image of a Mastercard but checkbox to agree to Visa's Terms and Conditions. A spelling error or two. So far I have not been able to use the promo code. I can enter it with no problem and a green checkbox appears, presumably to show it is valid, but when I click on "Order Card" a message "Promo Code not found" appears.  There are a lot of 3rd-party scripts on the order page and I disable them by default until I can see what they do. Chances are one of them needs to run to accept the code but I haven't investigated yet. There are also ten trackers on the page, which I don't allow by default. Most are commonplace, such as Google-analytics or Facebook, but I haven't yet checked them all out.  That's as far as I've got for now. I don't mean to make this sound worrisome - it's just messy, but typical of many sites these days, and of course might contain something that would bother me. I've got to do some real-life stuff for a while, but I'll get back to Cryptopay as soon as I can.  I'm aware that Cryptopay has as much to fear from Internet Strangers like me as I do from them. Wariness should serve us both well, but it slows things down.  Edit: Update - yes, enabling the scripts allows the promo code to be recognized. The card order went through shortly after that, and a nice customer-friendly welcome email followed. Very encouraging so far.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: The thing is that our system just doesn't process BTC transfers of amounts with more than 4 decimal digits. Yes, you can transfer directly from your USD wallet to a USD debit card, there will be 1% loading fee taken and no currency conversion fee!

Author: LeGaulois
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Got an email yesterday, in hope it is a joke ? Telling me that due to new requirements affecting providers of payment services, you add a new limit for all residents and french citizens, non-verified. As of May 1, 2017, my account and my identity must be verified by your compliance department. Why do you have to obey to this you're not a french company? Who is going to trust me if my id card date is expired but it is still a valid id card since the french gov added 5 years to cards previously made...It's not that i don't want to be verified, but due to this i am not sure my verification will be accepted.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi!  Yes, you can use your EUR/USD/GBP card to make a purchase in any other currency, but please be informed that in this case you will be charged a Foreign Transaction fee of 3%. You can find more information about Cryptopay card's fees and limits by following this link - https://cryptopay.me/bitcoin-debit-card.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: It is not allowed to receive direct payments to the Cryptopay cards. If you talk about the third-party load in a currency that is different from your card's, then yes, you will be charged a Foreign transaction fee of 3%.

Author: LeGaulois
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Your verification system ask for original scans/images without any compression or resizing and not altered in any graphic editing program. Body: Can an unverified virtual card be used for depositing to and withdrawing from a bookmaker or it would be blocked upon receiving money back from the bookie? @cryptopay_support

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  Under our card issuer's rules, 3rd party loads to unverified cards are prohibited. Yes, they get blocked once you receive money back from the bookie.

Author: zazzbg
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: @cryptopay_support  what's the process after that? can they be unblocked after passing verification?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes, you can unlock your card by providing the valid verification documents, but please be informed that this process could take up to 10 business days.  In order to verify your account, you will need to submit 2 types of documents:  1.) A valid government issued ID - high-quality images of the following documents are acceptable: ‚Ä¢ International passport (double page) ‚Ä¢ National ID card (both sides) ‚Ä¢ Driving license (both sides) Important: To avoid delays when verifying your account, make sure that your submitted documents are: ‚Ä¢ Entirely visible (watermarks are permitted); ‚Ä¢ Images of high quality (color images, with resolution of 300dpi or higher); ‚Ä¢ Valid ID documents with expiry date clearly visible.  2.) A proof of residency - a high quality scanned images or a direct online extract of the following documents: Bank statement, Utility bill, Tax return, council tax bill, Certificate of residency issued by a government, within the last 3 months and addressed to your name and home address. We cannot accept mobile phone bill or a credit card statement as proof of residence.  Note: For languages such as that use non-Latin characters, a certified translation of your proof of residence document will greatly speed up processing time.

Author: zazzbg
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: If I verify my account prior to withdrawing back from bookie is there any technical time needed between the time my account is verified and the time that the card is available for receiving money back and won't be blocked? @cryptopay_support

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  Yes, there is. After your Cryptopay account is verified we will forward your documents to our card issuer. They will review them within 7-10 business days and verify your card. After that, you will be able to make third-party loads.

Author: zazzbg
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Is there some kind of notification when my card is able to receive back money? How will I be informed that the changes are in effect?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: You will be able to check your card's verification status in your personal Cryptopay account.

Even if you have all the documents to verify yourself , if you aren't living at an English speakers country, you are going to have a nightmare in order to become verified.  they ask you to attach to the documents a translation from a certificate origin, and it is a big problem, as you need to find the company that will agree to do that, you need to pay them, and it is going to take few days until you get that.  Overall the service is good, but just keep in your mind that if you want to withdraw more then 1000$, this is not the best solution for you.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: We do require account verification only if the client does want to deposit funds via SEPA bank transfer or if the client is willing to verify an account in order to have higher VISA card limits and the ability to receive third-party card loads (card loads that are not processed through Cryptopay, eg. PayPal, betting website, Skrill). If there is a third party card load on an unverified card, it gets automatically blocked on our card issuer‚Äôs side and they do request full client verification, which may include the selfie ID, in order to unlock the card itself and any funds that are on the card. Unfortunately, we cannot block or suspend third-party card loads on our side, but we do take reasonable steps to let our client‚Äôs know that such loads would get their card blocked. It is absolutely crucial for us to be fully compliant with the current AML regulation, this does guarantee the sustainability of our platform and the reliability of our services.  Please do get in touch with one of our support agents on the live chat and they will be ready to assist you further on the case.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi!  I regret to inform you that you need to be an active member with the activity score higher than 30 on bitcointalk to get a promo code. Sorry for the inconvenience! Please be informed that Cryptopay card is a Visa prepaid debit card, not a MasterCard.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi!  It usually takes around 3 weeks to deliver a Cryptopay card to Europe with the standard free delivery option and 5-6 weeks to the rest of the world, but you can always opt for the express delivery by DHL which takes up to 10 days and costs $75.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hello,  You can load a Cryptopay card using any of the 4 available Cryptopay wallets (BTC/EUR/GBP/USD). Alternatively, you can link it and load through the Paypal, but please be informed that you have to become a verified customer in order to use this option. Cryptopay card works everywhere Visa is accepted, but please keep in mind that it doesn't have 3d secure.

Author: mzhacker
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Thank you please tell me 1. is shipping worldwide possible? 2. what are requirement to be verified?  thanks

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: 1. Please check the full list of countries where we can't ship our cards - https://support.cryptopay.me/hc/en-us/articles/206366353-Where-can-Cryptopay-card-be-shipped- 2. In order to verify your account, you will need to submit 2 types of documents:  1.) A valid government issued ID - high-quality images of the following documents are acceptable: ‚Ä¢ International passport (double page) ‚Ä¢ National ID card (both sides) ‚Ä¢ Driving license (both sides) Important: To avoid delays when verifying your account, make sure that your submitted documents are: ‚Ä¢ Entirely visible (watermarks are permitted); ‚Ä¢ Images of high quality (color images, with resolution of 300dpi or higher); ‚Ä¢ Valid ID documents with expiry date clearly visible.  2.) A proof of residency - a high quality scanned images or a direct online extract of the following documents: Bank statement, Utility bill, Tax return, council tax bill, Certificate of residency issued by a government, within the last 3 months and addressed to your name and home address. We cannot accept mobile phone bill or a credit card statement as proof of residence.  Note: For languages such as that use non-Latin characters, a certified translation of your proof of residence document will greatly speed up processing time.

Author: kotwica666
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  I have question about verification:  I'm not owner of apartment where i'm living, I just rent it. (all bills are coming with owner name) But i'm resident of this apartment, so i can get confirmation from the municipal office that i'm living there. It is this same adress like in my ID and Passport.  Do this confirmation of the residency from the municipal office will be sufficient as a second document? If yes, do this have to be in english, or can be in other language?  Or maybe verification can be done only with ID, Driving License and Passport?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi,  You can verify your identity, using ID, driving license and passport. This statement from the municipal office is sufficient to verify your residential address. It must contain your address and your full name and must be issued within the last three months.

Author: kotwica666
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Thanks for answer. Just to clarify: 1. So I can verify my identity with only ID, driving license and passport? 2. Or i need this statement from municipal office also? 3. And do this statement can be in other language then english?

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: 1. Yes 2. You need a statement to verify your address. 3. All documents with non-latin characters (like Arabic, Chinese, Japanese etc.) must be coupled with certified translation into English. Translation must be performed by a certified translator, it also must be signed and sealed.

Author: kotwica666
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Anyway verification only my identity will not remove limits from card, so i need this document from municipal office. I will try to get this paper tomorrow. It will be with latin characters, so let's hope tomorrow we will fix it.  Thank you.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! Thanks for reaching. Here are more clarifications:  1. There is 2500 lifetime load limit for all unverified cards. This is clearly stated on the product page here: cryptopay.me/bitcoin-debit-card . Lifetime load value is total amount of funds loaded both through Cryptopay and from other sources like PayPal or casinos.  2. Regulations change and sometimes swiftly. Our card issuer has decided to block all third party loads for unverified cards. This new rule has come into place without any prior notice on Monday. That's why many cards has been blocked. Right now, all cards are unblocked and there is some transition period in place untill Dec 1. So, if clients do not want to verify their ID and still accept third party loads, they should seek another provider. Sad but true. We will reach affected customers over the email tomorrow.   In regards to card delivery, it really depends. Contact the support team via livechat on the website and they will help you.

Author: acroman08
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: 1. I know about the limits. And I take it that's a yes. 2. I understand. Good to know you were able to manage a transition period for your clients. 3. I see, then I will do so. Thank you.

Author: lmcompany
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: BEWARE OF THEIR SERVICE, HERE'S WHY:  Some time ago I was in need of legit virtual visa issuer that accepts Bitcoin. My main criteria was anonymity, all I wanted is to avoid sending any personal IDs via the Internet. The winner of my attention was `cryptopay.me`, I was very happy with their service until today.  One of their site pages (https://cryptopay.me/bitcoin-debit-card) clearly states the following:   Screenshot of this quote in case they remove it after this post: http://i.imgur.com/4WXT0fs.png  I was like wow, "this is exactly what I'm looking for!".  Today my card's transaction history has stopped showing some last authorization, as well as I got a declined transaction twice when tried to make a purchase. I wrote about it to their support and got the unexpected:  FROM: support@cryptopay.me - Stanislav Petuhov (Cryptopay Ltd)  Nov 16, 12:41 GMT  Hello,  Your card has been blocked by our card issuer. To unlock it please provide verification documents:  1.) A valid government issued ID - high-quality images of the following documents are acceptable: ‚Ä¢ International passport (double page) ‚Ä¢ National ID card (both sides) ‚Ä¢ Driving license (both sides) Important: To avoid delays when verifying your account, make sure that your submitted documents are: ‚Ä¢ Entirely visible (watermarks are permitted); ‚Ä¢ Images of high quality (color images, with resolution of 300dpi or higher); ‚Ä¢ Valid ID documents with expiry date clearly visible.  2.) A proof of residency - a high quality scanned images or a direct online extract of the following documents: Bank statement, Utility bill, Tax return, council tax bill, Certificate of residency issued by a government, within the last 3 months and addressed to your name and home address. We cannot accept mobile phone bill or a credit card statement as proof of residence.  Note: For languages such as that use non-Latin characters, a certified translation of your proof of residence document will greatly speed up processing time.  Best regards, Stanislav Petuhov Screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/ZnVcE2Z.png  Of course I answered that I am not going to provide any documents as their site states I don't need to, and their 'issuer' can stay with my 500 euros.  Now I withdrew 6 BTC i had there and will not use this service anymore.  I hope this post will help those who seek anonymous debit cards to prevent any loses with this service in future.

Author: kotwica666
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: It is really strange. I was one from first persons that get their card, so i use it almost year without problems. If you've had so big turnover ("6 BTC, 500euros") maybe you exceeded the limit? Ask  them about the reason of blocking your card. Anyway you said that you withdraw 6 BTC, so your account is not blocked. It is blocked your card - so you should to know that Cryptopay is not card issuer. My card delivered by Cryptopay was issued by Wave Crest Holdings Limited http://www.wavecrest.gi/ Meybe better is contact directly with them..

Author: lmcompany
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: My account is not locked but my card is indeed and I can't get my money back (Unload card functionality is locked).  I've been using them for a long time as well, and told before that 'No ID verification is required' and the only reason I've been using their service was that statement.  I also have an old account with e-coin without a single issue like that and their issuer is the same, why should I care about it at all? I am the end customer of cryptopay.me and they should resolve this without my presence. Otherwise if they can't they should remove the statement 'No ID verification is required' from their site, because turns out it's a complete lie.  I don't want to contact their issuer directly because the main idea of using their service for me was anonymity, and this move will break my anonymity.  Also, the limit wasn't exceeded.

Author: kotwica666
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I understand that you're upset, but as you wrote Cryptopay account is not locked. So they don't have problem with you. If I may advise you, write them a request to explain the situation in your name. But I'd rather write directly to the card issuer.  Ps. I do not want to guess, but such situations happen when someone makes transactions/deposits in online casinos .. maybe this is the reason ..

Author: lmcompany
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I am not very upset, but money is money. While I understand they may not have a problem with me, I believed to their statement about "No ID is required" and was not expecting any lock by their issuer and thought they are confident with their backbone to not lock any customer's card.  If I knew about the risk of lock before, I'd simply avoid the service for good. I was not notified about that risk and now it resulted into the conflict between the end customer and service.  Also, the card transactions were not high risk or gambling (as you mentioned casino).

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi and sorry for this incident. We're facing additional restrictions from our card issuer regarding third party loads, like withdrawing from PayPal or online casinos. We're discussing this issue with card issuer, but it seems that they will require account verification for this transactions to avoid fraud. This means, that if you withdraw from PayPal you need your account to get verified.   As per "No ID is required", we're happy to clarify. According to AML/KYC rules in Europe, there is no such a thing as anonymous debit card, anonymous account or anonymous payments. This is totally illegal and any operator promoting anonymous financial services is breaking the law and it's management can face prison. What can be achived is privacy. We do not ask you for your ID and residence documents while your account activity is lower that 2500 Euros threshold and happy to have lower limit on card transactions. This is the difference between verified and unverified account.

Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: The way I understand it is, that any store that accepts Visa debits cards will accept it. Author: hogarth
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Did you have enough on the card for the gas station "padding"?  Taken from another vendor: Quote All gas station purchases have an additional charge called 'padding'. This is standard practice in the debit card industry - this means that we reserve a hold when you purchase at a gas station, and then once the transaction is completed, we refund the padding amount to your account.   Say you fill your tank at a gas station for $70 USD. Your total purchase value will hence sum $170 USD ($70 + $100). Once Xapo receives the settlement information from the merchant, usually within 24-48 hours, the padding amount will be returned to your wallet.   Padding amounts by debit card currency: - 100 USD - 85 EUR - 75 GBP

Author: adaseb
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Yes problem was resolved. THANKS!  My review:   I received the card about a week ago or so. I got the card for free as a promo. I had to call London UK to get it activated and get my PIN number. I only needed to input my card number and birthday and a PIN was assigned.  When I login into my Cryptopay.me I have an US dollar BTC address to send deposits. The deposits are almost instant only 1 confirmation. There is a 1-2% spread or something when it converts to US Dollars from the Bitcoinaverage.  Once my US Dollar BTC balance was loaded I proceeded to transfer it over to my physical card, however it failed for some reason. I sent a ticket and was resolved within a few hours. The second transfer was done instantly and appeared right away on MyChoiceCorporate.com balance.  I drove to an ATM. Tried withdrawing US Dollars but failed for some reason. I then withdrew Canadian dollars and it worked! Surprisingly there are no ATM fees at the machine, I guess its because its a Visa instead of a Debit card.  The fees are as follows  1-2% Spread when depositing into Cryptopay 1% loading fee 3% forex fee for USD/CAD $3.50 USD flat ATM withdraw fee.    The service works great and will use it from now on!  THANKS!!!!!

Author: adaseb
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Why is the spread so high today???  I sent some BTC and the Bitcoinaverage rate was $663 USD per BTC. On Bitfinex it was $660 USD per BTC.   But my exchange rate was $618 USD per BTC. So a spread of almost 7% and this doesn't include the loading, and ATM fees. A few days ago, I was only charged 2% spread.  Why isn't the actual US rate posted on the website only the Euro and Pound???   EDIT. After going to the ATM to withdraw the Forex rate also has a larger spread. Instead of being 1.30 USD/CAD its 1.2674 USD/CAD, its off by another +2.5%    So todays withdraw I was charged +7% to convert from BTC to USD +1% loading fee +5.5% forex fee $3.50 USD flat withdraw fee.  Which is about  15.25% in fees. Pretty much double from a few days ago, what is going on

Author: mobnepal
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Here is my first ATM withdraw from cryptopay debit card today,  I have deposited 110$ worth of bitcoin to cryptopay but after deducting some conversion charge my USD account get only 107$ and than when i load that amount to my debit card i have to again pay 1$ around. So i went to nearby visa atm and withdrawn 10000 NRS and i get one message from the BANK of that atm machine that they will deduct 5$ around NRS from my account and i thought it is the withdrawl fee charged by cryptopay as stated in their fee structure after that i get reciept and check my cryptopay card transactions in website. I get shocked to see 6.45$ deducted by cryptopay as fee, 5$ deducted by my bank as atm access fee. And i think there was also 4% foreign currency exchange fee.  Summary of how much i have paid in fee: 110$ x 107NRS = +11700 NRS I got = 10000 NRS in hand and 1.26$ remaining in cryptopay card.  So total fee = more than 1500 = 15$ for 100$ withdraw.   I can also provide screenshot to community if you don't beleive this. Card is only better to do online shopping or quick buy because of high numerous types of fees.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi, I believe you have not read the fee structure properly. Here is what we typically charge: - 1% loading fee - $2.5 ATM transaction  However, if you withdraw not in card currency (NRS in your case), you were charge foreign transaction fee of 3%. Additionally, the operator of the ATM has charged you a fee for withdrawal, which do not have any association to.  We understand that you are confused, but you cannot avoid some fees, especially if you are doing exotic transactions. In case there is a USD ATM in your country, you better withdraw in USD to avoid additional fees.

Author: mobnepal
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Thanks for clearing the doubt but what is that 6.45$ charged after i withdraw? doesn't that 3% foreign currency exchange fee is included during the USD to NRS conversion during withdraw. I am only confused on that and quite confused with your fee structure.

Body: Extremely unhappy with Spectrocoin debit card.  Email two factor authentication broken, as emails come hours later, which is too late.  Sadly, you can transfer bitcoin in without two factor.  You can also exchange bitcoin for USD without two factor.  Two factor is needed to both load your debit card with USD and to change the two factor to SMS, which hopefully is faster.  Customer service not helpful as I have done what they have said, but no change.  I want to switch to your debit card, so can you please provide a promo code.  I will happily share my experience.  As we start summer vacations, I intend to ONLY use my bitcoin debit card for traveling.  Thank you.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi!  At the moment, to activate the card, you basically need to have the plastic on hand, as we cannot send plastic card details to the email, this option is available only for virtual cards. Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi, there is not POS or online transaction fee in case you are shopping in your card currency. For example, you our have $100 on your card and you shop for $90, you would be left with $10 on your card. In case you have $100 on your card, but you are shopping for Euro 90, you would be left with less. There is 3% foreign transaction fee on purchases different from your card's currency. At this moment, this is out of your control, as this fee is charge both by card issuer and VISA.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: We're very sorry to tell you that, but this is out of your control. Issuing bank has its own rules and arrangements with VISA.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: The main difference is that we have another concept for currency conversions. With Xapo you link your bitcoin wallet to your card and when you make purchases, bitcoins are converted to the card currency at the market exchange rate, which you cannot control. With Cryptopay you top up your account with bitcoins and convert them to the desired currency and then load this currency to the card. In this case, you are in full control of bitcoin exchange rate. Long story short.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: I believe you do not get it right. Just before you convert your bitcoins to the currency, you are in full control of the exchange rate and you can cancel the transaction if you are not happy with the rate. With Xapo, you do not have this option and in case they would wider the spreads, you will convert the funds not on the best rate.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: TWITTER | FACEBOOK | TELEGRAM | MEDIUM | TRUSTPILOT  Founded in 2013, Cryptopay is one of the most popular and established digital currency service providers in Europe. However, our market isn‚Äôt limited to European countries, and our services and products can be used globally. We started as a payment gateway that allowed merchants to accept Bitcoin. The company first focused on API, making selling, buying and storing bitcoin a fast an easy experience, then we developed a full-blown digital wallet complemented with prepaid cards and payment services.   Products  We offer a selection of services all aimed to be your gateway between a decentralised world of cryptocurrency and conventional assets.    Bitcoin wallet  Cryptopay wallet is the core product that lays the foundation to all other existing services we provide. It‚Äôs a wallet where you can easily store, receive and send bitcoins. For even further convenience, Cryptopay introduced instant exchange options. You can exchange bitcoins into EUR, USD and GBP in case you want to avoid the market volatility of BTC. Bitcoins are instantly converted and no additional manual operation is required.     Litecoin wallet  With Cryptopay, "digital silver" wallet is as easy to use as our good ol' Bitcoin wallet: convert Litecoins from or to any of supported currencies - BTC, EUR, GBP, and USD.    Ripple wallet  Highly anticipated Ripple wallet is now added! Sending and exchanging Ripple is now as easy as ever. Try it now!   ETH wallet  We know it‚Äôs what everyone was waiting for. Ethereum wallet is now available.    Buy cryptocurrency with credit or debit card  You can buy Bitcoins, Litecoins, XRP and Ether using your debit or credit card. It is almost instant and no additional fees are applied as your card will be charged in GBP, EUR or USD, depending on the currency you prefer. If your card is in any other currency it is not a problem as well, the funds will be automatically converted using the applicable rate of your Bank. We accept cards with 3d secure from all over the world. Buying cryptocurrency is now easier than ever. You can find more information here     Bank transfers  You can utilise our bank transfer option to deposit and withdraw funds using your own EU bank account. You can deposit funds and buy BTC or withdraw your Bitcoins straight to your bank. Easy and hassle-free. You can find more information here    Coming soon     Digital Assets Portfolio  Perfect for experienced and beginner users. Diversify your cryptoportfolio in one click quickly and conveniently. Choose between multiple packages and hodl various cryptocurrencies while protecting your funds against market volatility.     Prepaid cards  C.Pay card is a prepaid card you can top up instantly by converting funds in your Cryptopay Bitcoin account to EUR, USD and GBP. It can be used anywhere regular prepaid cards are accepted.  At the moment we issue cards for Russian Federation only. As for the European card programme, our platform is now 100% ready to incorporate it technical-wise, but, we're yet to receive the final legal approve from one of our issuing partners.    Blockchain brokerage  Get access to real financial markets without leaving your Cryptopay account or using your bank. Buy stocks and bonds, invest in Indices and get leverage up to 4x.

Author: cryptopay_support
Title: Cryptopay: A Central Entry Point to a Decentralised World
Body: Hi! As long as there are no transactions, no fees would be charged. The fee would be charged only if the card was active during the month.
